newsitem.title: USA: Noble Drilling sees inadequate jackups supply. [CORRECTED 19:11 GMT 25/10]
newsitem.headline: Noble Drilling sees inadequate jackups supply. [CORRECTED 19:11 GMT 25/10]

text.p: Noble Drilling Corp said Thursday it anticipates the oilfield services industry having an inadequate supply of deepwater jackup rigs in the fourth quarter of 1997. (Corrects to make clear that company believes industry as a whole will have and inadeqaute supply of deepwater jackup rigs.)
The projection is based on the assumption there is no collapse of commodity prices, it said.
The company also said its worldwide drilling markets continue to strengthen -- to the point that, in some regions, demand exceeds supply.
Noble Drilling now has four jackups in shipyards in various stages of completion. The deepwater units are to be delivered in November 1996, April 1997 and December 1997.
